text: Bottle shared at the Leighton tasting 08/06/2017. Many thanks to Paul for this one. A milky cummy greyish white. Aroma is alcohol, rice, paint thinner, hint of pear. Flavour is composed of tangy pithy rice, floral notes, paint, hot alcohol. Pithy. Palate is bitty, harsh, solvent. I dont like it.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Paul. Pours cummy white. The nose has some vanilla, white bread, pale bread. Medium sweet flavour with more vanilla notes, polished white rice, mellow alcohol. Medium bodied. Fairly sweet on the finish, vanilla, more simple pale bread, a light chalky note. Good nigori.

Bottle split at Hackney Levels, thanks to Bropey, 08/06/17.
Spunky off white no head.
Nose is sweet, rice pudding, light spice, grains.
Taste comprises peach, water chestnut, vanilla, blemonge, sweet licks.
Medium + bodied, moderate carboantion, light boost in the close.
Ok.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle share at Leightons pad. Thanks to Scopey. Pours milky white. Aroma is lychee, rice and a little booze. Taste is rice, lychee and a little booze. Nice and smooth. Not bad

Bottle from Japan Centre London. Served chilled and shaken. It pours opaque white, kind of like bull milk... The aroma is quite soft, milky, creamy, definite rice vibe, floral, custard cream, strawberry and alcohol. The taste is smooth, drying upfront, creamy, sweet, mini milk, floral, 
rice, touch of raw alcohol, touch of berry yoghurt, chalky, tums and tannin. Finish is drying a bit chalky. Medium body and slightly chalky/grainy mouth - feel. It is certainly characterful. Chalky aspect is a bit off-putting after a while. Interesting stuff anyhow.
Bottle - Creamy light sweetness, almost strawberry. Cloudy white. Sweet and creamy with a light yeast and rice notes.
Glass at Peter Changs. Pretty milky white. Smell is almost grapes and lightly floral- not as boozy as some sakes. Mild flavor. Pleasant.

Pours milky white with lots of fine sediment. Aroma is very mild. Taste is slightly sweet with a warming alcohol finish. There is a mild floral, mint and rice notes. The rice sediment lends a creamy smoothness. Very good, much smoother than cheaper filtered sake.

Flasche (300 ml) aus dem Sunrise Supermarket, Pyongyang (1.480 KPW). - 
Weißlich, schön milchig trüb. - Matter Duft nach süßlichem gedämpfem Reis, Blüten und Pfirsich. - Im Geschmack mild, rund und weich mit zarter fruchtiger Herbe, aber etwas matt bzw. mehlig. - Reißt mich nicht vom Hocker.

I stoped by a local specialty liquor store, Uncorked, looking for a nigori sake. Ive had it in restaurants and really enjoyed it. I figured it was time to have a bottle or two at home. I decided to try this brand and a lower price brand to compare. This product gave me exactly what I wanted. A slight sweet taste, pleasant aroma and the milky color I expect with a nigori sake. I will be sure to always keep a bottle on hand as in continue my sake education journey.

Pink bottle from World Market, Charlottesville. I love me some nigori saki. Lets hope this one is a good one. Pours milky, similar to almond milk. Milkd rice aroma, with hints of delicate fruit and glue. Flavor is meh overall: gluey rice, tiny bit of floral hints. I can get better at Kroger.
Unique white milk colored sake. Great aroma with floral notes. However the taste is a little lacking in flavor. Not sure I would get again.

Bottle from bhensonb. Pours cloudy white with a few bubbles and a floral aroma. There is a delicate fermented rice flavor that leaves heat on the palate, but otherwise disguises the high alcohol content. Im not really a fan of sake, but this one was actually pleasant to drink.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 (Bouteille): Un liquide magnifique, divinement laiteux et raisonnablement homogène qui hurle son onctuosité. Le nez est hyper frais, noisettes, angles bananesques et riz collant qui se retrouve également en bouche. On est dans lélégance, la texture fondante et une discretion exemplaire de léthanol.

Bottle from Bine & Vine. Pours rather translucent water/perry color. Aroma is floral and rice. Smooth, smooth medium body. Flavor is clean without a trace of fusil oil. Call it rice with floral aspects. This may be the most delightful sake I can recall. Ill recap the rest and frig it for the next time Chinese takeaway enters the house.

Verre de dégustation chez Kyo Bar Japonais (Montréal, QC) au coût de 6,30$. Arôme: Odeur de riz avec une pointe de vanille et de banane. Apparence: La couleur est blanche laiteuse. Saveur: Goût de riz avec une très légère pointe de banane et de melon miel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. (Rating #6769)
My first sake, quite interesting. Has a nice creamy feel to it and the alcohol is well hidden.
(bottle) cloudy, milky white colour with no head; strong aroma of rice, alcohol; creamy palate; balanced flavour, no finish

My first sake rating, so take this review with a grain of salt. Aroma is booze, floral, steamed rice, somewhat fruity. Appearance is milky white, a slight pink hue, a bit of sediment hanging onto the side. Taste is rice, milk, fruit, a bit of booze, reminds me of standard grape wine. pretty unpleasant. Mouthfeel is creamy but light, lots of booze. Overall, hey its sake. Not a huge fan, but kampai! anyway.

Bottle shared. Pours milky white. Aroma of light vanilla, coconut, light milky, rice pudding. Flavour is light moderate sweet with a nice rice pudding, light nutty and light alcohol palate. Medium bodied.

pours very cloudy milky with a lot of tiny particles, some lacing. vanilla-flavored rice pudding, sweet powdery candies, booze, flowery and floury, woodsy notes - almost astringent - coconut milk with its nut, lot of minerals - chalk, faint bananas. light carbonation, medium body - oily and almost syrupy; sweet but never cloying; and warming lightly peppery astringent finish. nice relatively complex sweetish offering.
From a bottle. Pours opaque milky yellow. Tastes like smooth rice, very mild alcohol, light banana. Smells like smooth rice alcohol, light banana.
Bottle. Pours opaque milky white. Aroma is soft banana, sweet rice and citrus. Flavor is sweet rice, honeydew melon notes, light banana and a dry finish. Full body and still.
Bottle. Creamy milky pour. Aroma is rice, mango, and banana. Flavor is very smooth with light alcohol, fruity notes, and a tropical/melon finish.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2015 Bottle (300 ml). Split 2-ways with the lady. Shaken as the instruction says.

Appearance: Looks like coconut milk. Cloudy with sediments floating.

Aroma: Alcohol at first (though its not massively boozy) with light fruitiness, overcooked rice, coconut notes and light fruitiness.

Taste: Alcohol, moderate fruitiness, moderate to medium sweetness, coconut water, rice and floral presence.

Palate: Medium body. Milky mouthfeel. A bit viscous too. Moderate warming finish. Mild lingering coconut. 

Overall: My first sake rating so take this with a grain of salt (even though a huge amount of ratings doesnt necessarily translate in good ratings, take czar for example, he is almost at 5K now and is still writing a bunch of BS)  [ EDIT ;-) ]. Interesting first try. The alcohol is well hidden. Not really easily drinkable, but somewhat tasty and enjoyable. Looking forward to try a few more and get a better comprehension of Sake.
Bottle pour at School sushi. Very milk cloudy with a light melon taste and maybe some coconut. Enjoyable and good to sip. Boozy.

Bottle while grabbing quick lunch. Pours very opaque white. Nose is fruity and of rice. Tastes of strawberries, pineapple, honey dew, egg whites, rice, and coconut water. Touch starchy on palate but goes down smooth and hides abv. Nice summer sake
Disclaimer: Ive never had or rated sake before. Pours a milky white color. Nose of rice sugar, herbs, floral. Taste is astringent, sweet coconut. Smooth and silky mouthfeel.

Bottle. Pours like watered down milk. Aroma is rice, wine and some floral notes. Taste adds a sweet coconut milk note. Mouthfeel is chalky and a little sticky. This is actually incredibly enjoyable, but I'm not entirely sure how to convey that properly in a sake review.
Pours a creamy off white. Beautiful aromas of strawberries and red licorice. Similar flavor profile. Very good.

Exquisite packaging. Pours white. Nose of slight pepto-bismol, honeydew. Flavour is honeydew, coconut milk, good quality rice, alcohol. The first sake Ive really liked, I think Ive only had the cheapest stuff till now.

Bottle was opened a 3 days ago, finishing off the last few ounces. Served chilled in an ochoko-like glass cup. Pours very cloudy after shaking (which is good for a coarse filtered sake. Smells of rice being cooked. Wine is thicker than other sakes, in the same way skimmed milk is thicker than water. Taste is sweet on the tongue but quickly becomes very strong.

Rice settles if left too long. Leaves sugar-rice residue on cup.

Bottle. Its a very milky white sake, with some very fine light grey particles. Theres alcohol on the nose, hints of rice, as well as a good fruityness. Peaches and other tropical fruits. Theres a whole lot of fine grain particles in the mouth, with the strange viscosity Ive had in lots of sakes. Not oily, not full-bodied, not thin. Just cant find the word or words for it. Peaches, cucumber, some green grapes and a touch of rice in the flavor. Umami hints and a good dash of lighlty warming alcohol too. Long finish. A pleasant one, although Im not sure if I like the particles as coarse as in this one. 130903
Part of a sake sampler. Cloudy and decent amount of burn. Creamy taste on the palate.

375mL from La Bodega. Shaken as instructed- pours opaque milk with spots of sediment left on the sides of the glass. Soft, fruity nose full of coconut and pineapple. Tropical. Taste is starchy, a quick finish gives some dry/tannic rice starch but it isnt long or abrasive. A flash of fruity white alcohol up front fizzles rapidly. Refreshing, doesnt show the abv. Nice stuff.

Selected this bottle at a Japanese store this morning and literally didnt know what to expect... It pours out like skimmed milk (actually I hate that milk and prefer the full fat version, but probably every woman knows the look of skimmed milk): Cloudy light white colour, thin body. The nose was of flowers, peaches and Sake. Taste of eggwhite, pineapple, berries, flowers, rice and green fruits. Very dry finish. Enjoyed it a lot - one of the best Sakes ever!

It is really impossible to find a huge surprise like this one. Really. Where would you start ? That huge look of the bottle ? That huge look of the sake itself (mixture of milk and...soda...) ? Or maybe with that balanced aroma of ripe fruits and a huge ananas as a topping. Hard to explain. Just try. And be knocked out. Thumbs up. Definitely.

Dun blanc opaque, comme du lait écrémé, qui forme des bulles lorsquon le verse et qui disparaissent aussitôt. Ça sent lalcool fermenté, le riz froid avec des vapeurs deucalyptus, très faiblement et pas constamment. Le goût est semblable. Quelques pics alcoolisés qui ne sont pas sans rappeler certaines eaux-de-vie en provenance des pays nordiques; de lalcool "blanc", agrémenté dune saveur de pastille blanche, doù son côté sucré et médicinal. Une texture légèrement crémeuse et soyeuse qui fait bien passer le tout, alors que lalcool est perçu encore longtemps après la gorgée. (656-270513)

My first bottle of sake. Pours milky white with no head. Aroma is rice porridge mulk cream vanilla icecream flirsl and some spicyness. Flavor is velvety lean vanilla milky fruity a bit boozy apples cream. Good creamy fruity and a bit florsl aftertaste. Interesting, I really like this, afraid dont have any reference to other sakes yet.

(Bottle said to shake well before serving, due to intended sediment).  Opaque off white, like a faintly yellow milk.  Aroma is of dry rice grain, some sort of sweet berry, and raw plastic.  Flavor has a bit of coconut milk and honey tones, with a faint chalkiness, both in texture and in flavor.  Mouthfeel is too chalky and thick, like watered down yogurt.  Just a weird drink all around.

My bottle of this sake poured  a few tiny clear bubbles that quickly disappeared and left behind a milky/cloudy body with some fine floaties in it.   The aroma was a nice Nigori mellow mildly musty and  soft polished rice.  The creamy milky mouth feel was mellow at the start and finished with a stronger vinous alcohol aftertaste.  The flavor was dull at first and stayed mellow throughout until the finish where the alcohol comes through.  Quaffable and mellow, this Sake is an easy drink and I would recommend it for new Sake drinkers.
Bottle @ onto, bristol. Cloudy white unfiltered sake with citrus nose, light but smooth mouthfeel and creamy rice pudding taste. Touch of alcohol and jasmine in finish.
One of my favourite sakes. Sweet, rice, excellent both cold and warmed. A great sake.

From a pretty neat looking 300 ml bottle.  Pours a hazy milk white.  Taste is of rice, fruit and a touch of warming alcohol.  Has a floral and rice aroma.  The body is creamy, a bit coarse and coats the mouth.  Very easy to drink and quite enjoyable.  Well worth having again.
Lightly sweet nose with a touch of honey, hints of grapes and dough. The taste is lightly sweet with subtle honeysuckle, peach and pear, light honey.
Great sake.  Floral aroma, very smooth and tasty like a complex white wine.  Dangerously drinkable.

Little Lily is the perfect name to use when describing this delicate Nigori. It is bottled beautifully, tastes among the best, and is gentle on your palate. And like the White Crane it is soft and lifting with a solid organic white color. Sayuri is an excellent Sake!
Bottle, pours milky white, the aroma is rice, milk, soap, sweet.... the flavor is milky, flowers, dry some alcohol..... with sweet balanced finish....

Shaken it pours a milky white with a flat appearance.  Nose is somewhat soapy and floral, smidgens of tang creeping in, and some tropical fruit and/or melon on top.  Light, milky, softly sweet, soapy, floral flavors...a bit watery in the mouth though also quite milky as well...not much if any alcohol notes though and really clean if not florally soapy with a bit of melon rind, and with a sweetness that is very tame but still somewhat evident.  Nothing complex here, but Id be lying if i said this wasnt some unoffensive and easy drinking stuff right here....just has no complexity to speak of.

Courtesy of the Danish crewWhite color, like almond milk. Strong Sake aroma, rice, with strong fruitiness too; some alcohol. The mouthfeel is quite thick and a bit astringent; rice and starch; light fruity side (watermelon and honedew), some sweetness, and high alcohol perception.Interesting experience.
30 cL bottle. Pours hazy white, no head. Aroma is crisp rice fruity. Light yeasty note. Sweet, rice and slight phenolic. Sweet, fruity and rice finish. Simple and flavourful.

Bottle at Mondial, sorry my second sake rating.  Pours a coconut like milky body that appears unfiltered hence the color and the cloudiness.  Nice pineapple notes, berry tones.  Ricey and vinous in nature.  Id like to have another bottle of this.

Bottle shared by faroeviking, thanks bro! 
Pours milky with white lacings. 
Aroma is sweet and very fruity mainly papaya. 
Nice soft mouthful with notes of flowers and a little bit of sweet fruity white grapes.
Bottle from Faroeviking. It pours milk white leaving milky white lacings. The aroma is highly fruity with notes of sweet rice. Quite dry flavour with notes of flowers and sweet rice.
Bottle at Ungstrup. Cloudy milkey - no head. Rice. Sharpness. Fruity. Rice. Minerals. Light flowery. Cedartree. Rather sweet. Ok.

cloudy milky white , no head.
aroma of rice, faint flowery note.
flavor is rice, flowery, mild. very nice.
Bottled. A milky white sake. The aroma has notes of rice and cedar wood. The flavor is sweet with notes of rice, alcohol, flowers, and cedar wood, leading to a dry alcoholic and rice-like finish.
Bottle 30 cl. Courtesy of Ungstrup. Pours a cloudy opaque greyish white. Very sweet rice aroma. Medium body, again very sweet rice and candy with a little yeastiness. Alcoholic finish. 230311
I dont have my sake legs under me yet.  Pours a cloudy white and has an aroma of bubblegum and rice.  Taste is somewhat bland, mainly rice and boozy.  Didnt enjoy it very much.

Mondial 2010.  Sayuri Nigori pink bottle.  Pours a light milky white water.  Aroma is light fruity and floral aroma- fruit juice, fruity bubblegum, sugar, citrus and big melon- cantaloupe with hints of banana.  Flavor is more melon- cantaloupe, and honeydew, grass, honey- then slight solvent and alcohol in the finish.  Very nice though- refined and fruity.

Servi sur glace dans un beau restaurant japonais de Brossard. Liquide blanc, laiteux. Première expérience avec ce type de Sake, très bon, agréable, doux. La finale est enveloppante, longue et désaltérante.

Bottle RBSG 2010. Poured cloudy white color with sticky particle legs. Moderate coconut, almonds and melons aroma. Medium body with a creamy unfiltered texture. Medium pineapple, vanilla and coconut rice flavor with a medium creamy sweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations were met with a complex sake

BottleRBSG 2010 Pours murky and white. The aroma is a blend of coconut milk and vanilla. Medium to full-bodied with a very creamy mouthfeel. The flavor is sweet, but not cloying, and is reminiscent of coconut milk. Very nice. Bottle courtesy of KyotoLefty!

Bottle at the Grand Tasting during RBSG brought by .  Pours a milky and hazy light white.  Looks like Pocari-Sweat.  Soft sweetness, light fruit and esters.  Soft banana, a light alcohol that warms on the finish.

A Mes rate. Bottle thanks to Craig, via Chris.Smells floral as hell, with some glorious but delicate banana in the background. Not sure about this milky appearance, never had an unfiltered sake before. Also not a fan of the thick body. Flavour is good though. Identical to the aroma with a lengthy banana aftertaste. Good but weird.

Bottle 300ml.Unclear hazy to murky medium milk white color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, fruity, wood, moderate alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration, coconut peel. Body is medium, texture is oily and sticky, carbonation is flat, finsh feel is moderate alcoholic. [20100523]

bottle at chris -o ... milky white like water from boiled rice ... little alcohol ... little coconut ... little rice nose ... light chalky texture ... alcohol in backbone ... light rice ... again litttle coconut ... hint of white wine ... coats the mouth ...

unshaken ... very thin ... no life ... little alcohol... lack personality ...

This stuff isnt awful but I think Im still not used to sake yet. Pour a milky white and gas an aroma if alcohol, coconut and some wattery rice pudding. Flavor is sweet and boozy! There are some pleasant sweet rice pudding like flavors bur the blast of booze gives me the shivers.

300mL bottle. Beautiful Nigori pour. A gentile swirl leave a very fine particulate on the sides of my glass. Aroma is quite creamy... semi-sweet. Plenty of koji, tapioca, a bit of coconut. Slightly perfumy with some floral notes... lavender and jasmine first come to mind. A very pretty nose for sure. Flavor doesnt quite match the aroma, however. The alcohol isnt masked all that well. Some fruity flavors (pineapple most notably). Perfume. Quite floral and mostly dry. Koji, dried coconut and banana. The alcohol really comes to the fore on the palate and masks a lot of the the subtle flavors. Medium bodied with a very distracting chalky mouth feel mid-palate back to the finish... almost gritty at times. Decent, but an altogether forgettable nigori. 100th% for the style? Hardly...

This is very pretty in  the bottle.  Nice cloudy white.  The smell is of a rich red wine.  There is also a sweetness to the nose.  The palate is very creamy.  Hints of berry with red wine after tone.  Very floral and a lot of different notes to pick up off of each sip.

Pours a milky cloudy white with a slight yellow tint.  The sake leaves a little bit of sediment on the sides of the glass. Aroma is very unique with some hints of berry and a little bit of floral . There is something else here that I cant put my finger on but I like it. The flavor is very interesting and not at all what I expected. There is some strawberry and plenty of booze. There is certainly an woodiness that works well with a very vinous red wine like character, its mildly sweet but far more dry. The palate is odd but intriguing, the sake is very thick and leaves a sort of residue on your mouth.

300ml Bottle. Shared with French tickler and Grand Genie. Appearance is white and looks like milk diluted with water.  Aroma: Baiileys. vanilla yogourt, rice, banana and coconut milk.  Flavor: Alcohol (Vodka), vanilla, lactose and  rice.  Palate: light body, creamy oily texture and no carbonation.

"Dégusté" avec Agaguk et grandgenie.  Apparence tres lactique, lait en poudre diluée dans de leau, fine particule blanche apparente... Aromes de coconut, lait écremé. lait de coconut, riz.  De loin le meilleur de son style mais tout de meme pas dans mes interets des plus profond.  Sensation de lactose, beaucoup dalcool corps moyen.  LEGER gout dapricot, lait de coconut reviens, eau de riz.  Je dois dire a nouveau que ce nes pas dutout mon style, par contre je dois avouer quil es pas mal moin pire que son précédent.

Ma première expérience de saké....

Acheté à la LCBO, et dégusté dans un verre dieu du ciel du 10e aniversaire. Bouteille de 330ml millésimé 2008. Apparence impressionnante couleur du lait écrémé, sans effervescence et laissant un gros dépôt sur les parois du verre. Arômes de vanille, banane, coconut avec une touche de vodka. Un goût dalcool de vodka, de riz et de gogi qui est un fruit disponible pour cest bien fait dantioxidant. Jadore, elle est équilibré, plein de corps, une longue finale et on ne pourrais dire le 12.5%. Une belle création, une belle bouteille et de la finesse. Je ne sais pas le profil de vieillissement mais je vais essayer dans faire vieillir. 

Jai un présentiment, je vois très bien un repas avec comme partenaires de bon sushis.....

$5.49 Bottle... Pours and looks like skim milk. Leaves film and particles on the walls of my glass. Aroma is sweet, with banana, vanilla, marzipan, koji, alcohol and even a hint of cinnamon snicker-doodle. Taste is straight koji, with a bit of sweet rice grain. Can feel the particles on my tongue, a bit chalky. Light cedar notes as well. Some fresh flesh.  Very creamy and milky texture, like 2% fat milk. A bit alcohol forward for the abv.

300mL Bottle at Zen - Bucktown, Chicagio, IL. Served chilled. Soft plum alcohol and apple blossom. Wet. Pours a cloudy white. Light grainy rice sugar, alcohol. Apple flesh, light asian pear, and some sweet yeast esters. A bit of apricot and yeast. Nice. Quickening and vibrant. Not an overly complex or floral sake, but the deeper koji texture and notes add to the light, delicate character of this example.

Im starting off my experiment in sake with the most affordable bottles.  This is probably a bad idea.  If I did that with beer Id be an avowed teetotaler, but so far the experience has been very pleasant, in part thanks to the approachability of Hakutsurus delicious nigori-zake, Sayuri.  The pink bottle might throw you off.  The sake isnt pink nor are the flavors really pink.  This was almost disappointing.  Ive clashed with the Japanese love for artificial strawberry flavoring before.  The best strawberry milk in the world easily comes from Japan.  So I had expected something of a strawberry note in the Sayuri thanks to its roseate glow.  No such taste, Im afraid.  Underneath the thick blanket of creamy sediment (leaving a grittiness on the tongue that I rather enjoy) is mostly a musk melon sweetness, which lounges around the tongue until you decide to swallow it.  Then an alcohol burn leaps from the unassuming fruity flavor and toasts its way all the way down the esophagus.  In effect, the Sayuri is very contradictory - somehow light yet very milky, somehow sweet (melon and mochi) yet very strong in its alcohol notes.  The aroma is very difficult to catch, but mostly resembles the initial sweetness before the alcohol bite.  Hakutsurus Sayuri is a very pleasant drink and certainly a good way to ease into sake, especially if you have unconfirmed but curious drinkers as guests.  This seems like it would be the Lindemanns of sake.

Skim milk color, chalky unfiltered appearance.  Aroma is delicate honeydew and alcohol.  Flavor is mellow fleshy fruits: honeydew, pear.  Very sweet, rice milk notes.  A little boozy in the finish.  Mouthfeel is thick and chalky.

300 mL bottle.  Looks like thin milk, and leaves a lot of sediment on the glass.  The aroma is of alcohol, sweet strawberries, and alcohol.  Thick, creamy, grainy mouthfeel.  The taste is sweet, fruit/berries, alcohol, and coconut.  Interesting, but not really my thing.
300 ml bottle from Mitsuwa Market Place:  Cloudy milky color. Delicate sweet rice aroma. Light creamy, fruity, melon like flavor. Delicate creamy, chalky mouthfeel.
Coarse white clouds, good packaging, floral aromas, some body, not much texture, a bit of phenols, touch of effervescence and alcohol.

300ml bottle from the LCBO. Pours a very cloudy white, nice. Aroma: At first, unpleasant nail polish, but, seconds later, that changes to honey-due melon, fruity sweetness, like sweetened milk. Very intriguing. Flavour: Surprisingly alcoholic, but not cloyingly so. Thick mouth-feel. Interesting, chalky fruitiness, with a rough bite to it. A nice sipper, and thankfully it hasnt scared me away from Sake, as this is my first example ever.

From my thin understanding of Sake this is how traditional crafted sake should look, taste and feel.

Pours a milky white, with substantial almond-grape tones with a musty koji tone.

Full bodied for a sake, sweetish, fruity (melon) and creamy smooth. Sweetish-fruity finish with warming following.

A great example of the Nigori style

[946-20071208] 300mL. Strangely watered down Buckleys cough syrup. Colloidal milky white body with no head. Coconut flavour has nice qualities. Light body. Interesting but most people trying it that night thought it was remarkably like puke...
300ml bottle. creamy soy milk-like color. lively fruity nose contains bananas and lychee with other tropical fruit. medium to thin body. soft and sweet with a creamy and balanced mouth.

(300ml bottle) Purchased at the Penny Farthing in Oak Bay for $13. Pours a cloudy white coconut milk colour with a marzipan and alcohol nose. Very fruity flavour up front with a gritty chalk texture. Solid tip of apple juice melds with a milky cream and whiskey. Very interesting and enjoyable.

Bottle-LCBO-Pours cloudy opaque creamy white. Lots of green grape, alcohol, milk, some rice as well.  Gooseberry, lots of lactic milky flavours, alcohol, rice, some fruity sweetness. Very gritty mouthfeel as per the style of beverage. Milky ,creamy finish. Very good.

Bottle, Jimmys Beer StoreOpaque white.  Aroma of koji, alcohol, wood.  Smooth body. Light apple skin, soft spiciness, light koji.  Finishes warmly.  Nice balance.  Delicious nigori, both approachable and interesting.

300mL Bottle: Pours a very thick milky white with moderate sized particulates. I really dig the bottle and label design, it conveys a very mature and deliberate persona. The nose is a bit fruity with very subtle alcohol along with the typical chalky rice and koji notes you get with a nigori. The sweetness accenuates the fruitiness in the nose and theres some watermelon and taro bubbletea notes. The flavor is... Well, lets start with the mouthfeel, its akin to milk with flour mixed in. Creamy and smooth, but a chalky and gritty quality that passes through your teeth noticably. The flavor is nice though; a delicate sweetness and alcohol seesaw. The acidity plays with the nihonshu-do like honey and lemon chasing each other around a grassy pasture. Nice sake, I was in the mood for something like this. For the cons, it could be a little thinner with less alcohol notes for only 12½%. Worse the warmer it gets. Nice nigori, especially for Hakutsuru.

Bottle purchased at Bevmo!, Sacramento-Natomas.  Bottle is a frosted, pink color with a very feminine label.  Aroma is lightly sweet, grainy, and a bit floral.  THere is a little bit of an ethanol presence retronasally.  Opaque, milky coconut milk color with no head, but a very nice legging with some fine particulars adhering to the sides of the glass.  A lightly sweet, spritzy effervessence greets the tongue to start.  Middle has some fruity presence, wildberries.  Flavor also tends to be quite floral as well.  A small ethanol presence comes through late and lends a warming sensation to this sake.  The mouthfeel is creamy and rich, just like a nigori should be.  I enjoyed this.
